I can not stress this enough.

ONLY PLAY THIS GAME, IF YOU HAVE 4 FRIENDS TO PLAY CUSTOMS. 
I can not recommend this game to anyone who wants to play this publicly. I owned this game since 2016, when only the simple killers were out, and not as much perks. Now? My god. You could be miles away from a killer but because someone got hooked/hit, you're now seen and the killer makes a b-line for you instantly.

Sometimes you spawn next to the killer. There're so many killers right now with disgusting personal powers, yet they are able to equip 4 OP optional perks. My last game and last straw, was my last three matches where the Doctor was no where near me, yet when he used his power, I screamed out and was damaged.

The other was where the killer simply had the perks to see the auras of other survives when hooking, and running full speed at us because of Legion.

Like, what's the point? Grab your friends, go play customs. If no friends, don't buy it.

СТРАШНО весело! Игра и щекочет нервишки и дарит много веселья. Хорошая игра как для друзей, так и для рандомных "друзей", и с теми и с теми скучно не будет. По началу было конечно страшно, но сейчас уже азарт затмил всё в голове, хотя бывает, что убийца может напугать до потери пульса и с визгом ты несешься куда угодно, лишь бы тебя за филейную часть прекрасного аватарного тела не цапнули.

Honestly this review is more for returning players or players coming back and wondering if they want to try out new killers or survivors.

DBD was one of my more played games back when i was on console easily hitting the 500 hour range and so when I came to PC eventually I picked it back up out of curiosity and had a good time again. Until shortly after they added their MMR system which has single handedly ruined the game of any fun to be had anymore. I can no longer play matches with people of my rank and am instead thrusted into matches with other extremely high rank players with thousands of hours in the game, I can play 13 matches as a killer and only kill 2 players due to them being so beyond my league and playing as a survivor is somehow even worse. The old system that relied on the ranks was flawed but only really needed changes or tweaks not a whole new system. Is it better for new comers? is it just that as a previous player it accidentally put me in too high of a skill branch in the MMR? I honestly don't have the faintest idea. 

I enjoyed steaming and playing this game when I could and the new survivors and killers were all pretty enjoyable, until they decided to shoot this game in the foot instead of making minor changes. I'll come back when the MMR is removed and it goes back to the previous system or they actually make the MMR playable for people who haven't exclusively played this game since release.

If i had to summarize this game into a single word it would be: Toxicity.  

DBD somehow is able to magically trap every player into playing 4-5 toxic, infuriating games to enjoy 1 fair game.  You will be trapped in this cycle.  I did not realize this until 600 hours in.  The game's core mechanics are for whatever reason designed so that the most toxic killer or group of survivors wins.  If you are not toxic, you will not win.  It is not a matter of who is and is not toxic, but a matter of whomever is more toxic, wins.  This is not just killer to survivor gameplay, but also survivors own team dynamics - the most toxic teammate will have the most XP and survive.

Side Note: I will give credit where credit is due.  The devs do try hard to balance the game and are very active with revitalizing and keeping the game alive with frequent DLCs (maps, killers, survivors, leveling updates, et.).  Although, to die hard DBD players, a week or two after a character drop for a balancing update is unacceptable.  Characters are constantly called "Broken" and each update changes whichever character is broken.  In reality, I think the devs listen pretty well to the community and balance the game pretty well.  The "balancing" complaints are more of a reaction to the toxic nature of the gameplay which is created by the core players, of which are the most toxic players in the community playing with and against each other in the most toxic inner circle of the game.  I know this because I was religiously involved in the game since first DLC drop and was rank 1 survivor for years of gameplay.

Disclaimer: If you enjoy games that are often labeled as toxic (COD, Overwatch, LoL, Fortnite, etc), & are looking for a competitive, non-FPS genre game that is absolutely more toxic than those games (in gameplay, not coms/chat).  This game is for you.

Was soll ich sagen...
Letztendlich funktioniert das Spiel wie Glücksspiele. Der Großteil der Runden macht wenig Spaß oder ist sogar einfach nur frustrierend. Aber immer mal wieder gibt es einzelne Runden, in denen es mal keine Klickerer, Teabagger, Camper, Tunnler, etc gibt, sondern man einfach mal das Spiel genießen kann, ganz unabhängig davon, ob man nun "gewinnt" oder nicht.
Neueinsteiger brauchen auf jeden Fall viel Geduld, aber ab und zu lohnt es sich sogar, Dead by Daylight zu spielen.

You can't have fun playing this game, at all.
You play survivor, you have teammates that are incapable of holding the m1 button. 
You play killer, and either face the same people you get as surv, or godlike people that can spin you for hours on end on L T walls.
The only way to beat the game is to not play the game. Don't buy this, you will lose time that could've been used for studying, learning a craft, or an instrument.
It's too late for me now, I haven't seen any daylight in the past year, her lullaby is stuck in my head, people are always horny, and now I am too. 
The community is mostly trash, and finding nice people to play with is extremely hard.

But sometimes, just sometimes, in extremely rare situations, you just might have fun while playing it
